newsitem.title: UK: London platinum fixes at two-month low.
newsitem.headline: London platinum fixes at two-month low.

text.p: London platinum fixed at $390.00 an ounce on Thursday, the lowest since July 11, 1996.
Platinum shed $3.00 from its previous fix on Wednesday afternoon and dealers said further losses down to $385 an ounce were possible.
London platinum fixes at two-month low =2
Sentiment in the platinum market has been bearish in recent weeks amid a lack of buying interest from consumers and investors. Platinum is used primarily in the jewellery and auto industries.
Gold prices were also weaker at $382.35 an ounce, down more than a $1.00 from Wednesday's London close.

Gold has been under selling pressure in recent weeks, but market jitters have intensified ahead of a Friday International Monetary Fund meeting to discuss a plan to sell part of the IMF gold reserve to help aid poor countries.
Several bullion market analysts said a price dip towards a 2 1/2 month low of $380 was likely.
